page.title: 17RECREATION
page.content: SOMERSHAM IS WELL ENDOWED WITH LEISURE AREAS, EITHER NATURAL OR WHERE VARIOUS SPORTING CLUBS MEET. OF THE NATURAL AREAS SOMERSHAM LAKE IS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE, AN OLD BALLAST HOLE FROM THE RAILWAY, WHICH IS NOW MANAGED TO PROVIDE FISHING AND A PLACE TO WALK TO OBSERVE THE DUCKS, SWANS AND OTHER WILD LIFE. ADJACENT TO THIS IS A DISUSED RAILWAY LINE PROVIDING A FURTHER PLACE TO WALK AND ENJOY THE COUNTRYSIDE. A SIMILAR DISUSED AREA CAN BE FOUND IN THE S.E. CORNER OF THE SURVEY AREA CONSISTING OF SEVERAL DISUSED GRAVEL PITS. SOMERSHAM AND COLNE BOTH HAVE PLAYING FIELDS WITH CHILDREN'S PLAY APPARATUS AND CATERING FOR FOOTBALL AND CRICKET ON THE SOMERSHAM FIELD. OTHER AREAS INCLUDE A FOOTBALL CLUB, 2 BOWLING CLUBS AND A RIDING SCHOOL.
